story.iWant: I want to know which personas and domains are being copied or accessed
story.tasks: - [ ] Table + helper (AC: 1 & 5) - [ ] Create DuckDB table `persona_usage` via init script if missing. - [ ] Add helper `log_persona_usage(persona_id, domain, action, channel)` in `backend/services/logging.py`. - [ ] Integrate with UI/API (AC: 1–2) - [ ] Persona API accepts query param `log_usage=true/false`. - [ ] Streamlit copy button calls logging helper unless disabled. - [ ] Export path (AC: 3) - [ ] Extend Story 2.6 export helper to support `--usage`. - [ ] Add Streamlit button for quick CSV export. - [ ] Docs (AC: 4) - [ ] README section covering logging + env toggle.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Whenever a persona card “Copy story” button is clicked or the persona API is called with `include_usage=true`, a `persona_usage` table row is written (columns: `id`, `timestamp`, `persona_id`, `domain`, `channel` [UI/API], `action` [view/copy], optional `notes`). 2. Logging can be disabled via env flag `DISABLE_PERSONA_LOGGING=1` for privacy-sensitive sessions; default is enabled. 3. CLI/Streamlit provide an “Export usage log” option that writes CSV/Parquet under `exports/` similar to Story 2.6. 4. README documents how to view/reset usage logs and references the env toggle. 5. Logging is lightweight (no blocking UI); failures are logged but don’t break persona rendering.
